title: Sources: Japanese home run king Murakami posts
content: Japanese star third baseman Munetaka Murakami, who owns the single-season home run record for a Japanese player in Nippon Professional Baseball, is entering the posting system for MLB teams, sources told ESPN.

title: Dodgers' Vesia says baby daughter died Oct. 26
content: Dodgers reliever Alex Vesia, who missed the World Series because of what the team said at the time was a "deeply personal family matter," said Friday his daughter, Sterling, died Oct. 26.

title: USC QB pulls off fake punt wearing No. 80 jersey
content: USC pulled off a remarkable fake punt against Northwestern on Friday night by sending out third-string quarterback Sam Huard in the same uniform number as the Trojans' punter.

title: UNC makes early statement in taking down Kansas
content: North Carolina validated head coach Hubert Davis' retooling of the roster, rallying to earn the Tar Heels' first win over Kansas since 2002 in an 87-74 victory Friday night.

title: Miss. State prez: SEC prefers no auto-bids in CFP
content: Mississippi State president Mark Keenum, the chair of the College Football Playoff board of managers, told ESPN's Paul Finebaum on Friday that the SEC would prefer to "not have automatic bids" in future iterations of the playoff.

title: Washington GK Hamant dies of cancer at age 21
content: Mia Hamant, a goalkeeper for Washington's women's soccer team who helped the Huskies reach the semifinals of the Big Ten tournament, has died at age 21.

title: Spoelstra grateful for help after fire ravages home
content: Miami coach Erik Spoelstra expressed gratitude for the support he received after a fire destroyed his home.

title: UK's Calzada sorry for video flaunting NIL money
content: Kentucky QB Zach Calzada apologized Friday after responding to social media criticism of his play with a video in which he boasts about his NIL money.

title: üèÄ Latest NBA intel on futures of Ja, Zion, Trae
content: How close are the Grizz, Pelicans and Hawks to trading their stars? Is Giannis Watch over? Tim Bontemps and Brian Windhorst have the latest.

title: How Mizzou beats A&M, the biggest Big 12 game in years, a test for Oregon, and more
content: A top-10 meeting in Lubbock, an upset bid in Iowa City and a pair of SEC tests headline the weekend slate.

title: 15 NFL experts, 15 midseason predictions: We made our best calls for tight playoff races, more
content: Can the Bucs reach the Super Bowl? Will Myles Garrett win DPOY? We asked 15 experts to give their predictions for the rest of the NFL season.

title: Early takeaways: Hidalgo is Notre Dame's singular star, UConn can run it back
content: UConn? As good as expected. Tennessee? Still chasing elite status. And Notre Dame? Heavily reliant on Hannah Hidalgo.

title: The best power conference in men's basketball will surprise you
content: Which league will produce a national champion? We track power conferences on the road to the Final Four.

title: In search of the real Nikola Jokiƒá
content: A trip to Sombor, Serbia, paints a portrait of the elusive Nuggets star by the people who know him best.

title: How the Jets, trying to overturn years of misery, made franchise-altering moves in less than two hours
content: With much of the Jets organization at Nick Mangold's funeral, a pair of big trades were in the works 2 miles away.

title: Best October players, greatest games, bonkers moments and more
content: We celebrate the past 30 years of playoff baseball with a look back at some of the most memorable moments since the wild-card era began.

title: The good, the bad and the ugly: Are Liverpool back to their best?
content: Liverpool have looked like both world beaters and distant also-rans in 2025-26, but after a tumultuous summer, the Reds may have just turned a corner.

title: After 2024-25 nightmare, Man City can prove spooky season is over
content: The woes of last season are starting to fade, but a clash with Liverpool will show whether City can contend.

title: Close race for No. 1 between bantamweight, welterweight
content: Two former champions will go for their second titles at UFC 322, giving their new divisions extra firepower.

title: Mick Schumacher can rewrite his story with IndyCar legacy team
content: Mick Schumacher's too-brief F1 career unceremoniously ended in 2022, but his desire for open-wheel fulfillment may yet lead him to IndyCar in 2026.

title: Lando Norris on pole in sprint qualifying
content: Lando Norris took pole position for Brazil's sprint race in what he will hope will be a weekend he takes a stranglehold on the Formula 1 drivers' championship.

title: ATP Finals preview: Who's in and what to watch
content: Can anyone get past Sinner and Alcaraz? Will Djokovic play? Everything to know as the ATP Finals begin Sunday.

title: New champ, McIntyre suspended, what now for Rhodes?
content: Friday's "SmackDown" left us a new women's champ and questions about the future of the Undisputed WWE Championship.

title: Vergil Ortiz Jr. vs. Erickson Lubin: Five things to know
content: Can Vergil Ortiz Jr. win his first world title? Will Erickson Lubin test Ortiz and finally win the "big fight"?

title: Jake Paul's new fight wish list: Canelo Alvarez, Ryan Garcia, more
content: Jake Paul has fought six fighters off his wish list of 12. Now the YouTuber-turned-boxer shares a new list.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Bayern eye move for Liverpool's Konat√©
content: Bayern Munich are looking at a possible move for Liverpool's Ibrahima Konat√©. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Missed flight, cleared no gate: How British national slipped past Delhi immigration; hunt on
content: A British national, Fitz Patrick, allegedly bypassed immigration formalities at Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport after arriving from Bangkok. He was discovered missing during routine checks, prompting an investigation into how he exited the terminal. Authorities are utilizing CCTV footage and intelligence to trace his whereabouts.

title: 'Bhaiya, what're you doing': Woman says Rapido driver tried to grab her legs; firm replies
content: A woman in Bengaluru has accused a Rapido bike taxi rider of inappropriate behaviour. She reported the rider attempted to grab her legs during a journey. The incident has prompted an investigation by Bengaluru City Police. Rapido has expressed concern and stated that passenger safety is a top priority. The company is looking into the matter.

title: Delhi airport tech snag: Normalcy restored a day after 800+ flight delays; advisory issued
content: Operations at Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport have returned to normal following a technical glitch in the Air Traffic Control's flight planning system. The issue, which affected the Automatic Message Switching System, led to widespread flight delays yesterday. Authorities are working to minimize passenger inconvenience.

title: ‚ÄòKnew F-16s could deliver nukes‚Äô: Ex-CIA officer makes big claim on Pak
content: Former CIA officer Richard Barlow revealed that US Presidents certified Pakistan as a non-nuclear state until 1989, despite intelligence showing modified F-16s could deliver nuclear weapons.  Washington prioritized Pakistan's Afghan war cooperation over non-proliferation, even tipping off Islamabad about an operation to arrest a nuclear smuggler.

title: Workplace ethics: Strict or flexible? IBM, JPMorgan CEOs split over phone during meeting
content: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon champions a strict no-phone policy in meetings, deeming device use disrespectful and a waste of time. In contrast, IBM CEO Arvind Krishna believes context is key, differentiating between small, focused discussions and larger informational sessions where device use might be acceptable. Dimon's frustration with divided attention is evident, even in virtual settings.

title: Robbery bid failed in Ahmedabad: Woman throws chilli powder at jeweller. How he responded
content: A dramatic robbery attempt at a Ranip jewellery shop ended in failure. A woman threw chilli powder at the owner to steal valuables. The powder missed its target. The shop owner reacted swiftly. He struck the woman multiple times before pushing her out. CCTV footage of the incident has gone viral. Police are searching for the woman and investigating further.

title: 'Mistakenly applied': LJP (RV) MP inked on both fingers after polls; admin responds
content: In response to concerns over potential voter fraud, the Patna administration confirmed that the ink marks seen on LJP MP Shambhavi Chaudhary's fingers were a result of an error made by polling staff, not an instance of double voting. The Presiding Officer promptly rectified the situation by marking her left hand instead.

title: Did Israeli lawyers warn of Gaza war crimes? What US intel found and why Biden admin was worried
content: US intelligence revealed Israeli military lawyers' internal warnings about potential war crimes in Gaza, fueled by US weapons. Despite public defenses, private doubts emerged.  The Biden administration delayed sharing this alarming assessment, deepening concerns over civilian targeting and aid obstruction, even as a UN inquiry found acts of genocide.

title: Apple's CarPlay Ultra: Automakers in split with adoption; Ford CEO warns of overreach
content: Ford CEO Jim Farley expressed strong concerns about Apple's CarPlay Ultra, fearing it encroaches too deeply into vehicle control. He questioned how far Apple's brand should extend into car functions, emphasizing the digital experience as a key differentiator for future vehicles. This follows similar reservations from other automakers and GM's decision to drop both CarPlay and Android Auto.

title: IND vs AUS: Why Tilak Varma is not playing the crucial 5th T20I - Explained
content: Suryakumar Yadav confirmed that Tilak Varma will play no part in the final T20I against Australia, with Rinku Singh returning to the playing XI. This decision reflects India's rotational approach ahead of the T20 World Cup, allowing players to be tested in different roles and combinations. A win will secure a series win for the visitors.

title: ‚ÄúIt was only later that I discovered...‚Äù: US singer ‚Äòtricked‚Äô into marrying ex-Malaysian King
content: American singer Brittany Porter claims she was 'tricked' into marriage with the former King of Malaysia, Sultan Muhammad V, believing it was an engagement.  She now seeks a 'proper divorce' after the Sultan allegedly disappeared and she discovered he was still married to another woman. Porter is channeling her heartbreak into music.

title: Future of AI: 'I would have dropped out if...'; Nvidia CEO's message to Zuckerberg
content: Nvidia's Jensen Huang and Meta's Mark Zuckerberg shared insights on AI's future and building tech empires. Huang humorously wished he'd dropped out like Zuckerberg, while both acknowledged their long journeys and mutual admiration. Nvidia's remarkable rise to a $5 trillion valuation was highlighted, contrasting with Zuckerberg's own dorm-room beginnings leading to Meta's trillion-dollar status.

title: Land deal case: Trouble for Pawar's son? Firm told to pay stamp duty of Rs 21cr with penalty
content: Authorities have demanded Rs 21 crore in stamp duty and penalty from Amadea Enterprises LLP for a cancelled 40-acre land deal in Mundhwa. The firm, co-partnered by Parth Pawar, had sought stamp duty exemption for a data centre project, but its cancellation has nullified the concession. The sub-registrar insists on full payment before re-submitting the cancellation deed.

title: Huge blow for IND! Rishabh Pant hit multiple times during match against SA; retires hurt - Video
content: Rishabh Pant suffered an injury scare during the 2nd India A Test match against South Africa A, retiring hurt after being struck multiple times by a South African pacer. The wicketkeeper-batter was hit on the helmet, elbow, and body, prompting medical attention and a concussion check. He then walked off the pitch accompanied by medical staff.

title: 'Mentally tortured': 30-year-old woman found dead; husband, 6 in-laws booked for murder
content: A 30-year-old woman was found dead under suspicious circumstances in Faridabad, with preliminary findings suggesting strangulation. Her mother has registered a murder case against her husband and six relatives, alleging continuous harassment and threats. The deceased had reportedly called her mother the day before her death, stating she was being troubled and threatened.

title: Candace Owens thanks Daily Wire after being fired as her podcast becomes world‚Äôs No. 1
content: Candace Owens states her podcast is now the world's number one show. She credits her firing from The Daily Wire for this success. Owens was dismissed in March 2024 after criticizing Israel's actions in Gaza. She believes the separation brought her significant publicity. Her new show is now topping global podcast charts.

title: Cricket at LA Olympics 2028: How teams will be picked; why no guarantee of India vs Pak
content: There could be a strong possibility of not seeing an India vs Pakistan contest at Los Angeles Olympics, as the details of the global qualifier are still unknown. In the detailed statement after the ICC Board meeting, the sport's global body mentioned the success of women's cricket and also shared an update on the LA28 Games.

title: Why Zarine Khan‚Äôs funeral followed Hindu rituals ‚Äî son Zayed fulfilled her last wish
content: Zarine Khan, wife of actor Sanjay Khan, passed away at 81. Her funeral was conducted according to Hindu rituals, as she was born Hindu and never converted to Islam. Her son Zayed Khan led the 'dah-sanskar', fulfilling her last wish.

title: What happens if you fall into a blackhole, spaghettification explained
content: Falling into a black hole means facing extreme stretching, known as spaghettification, due to immense tidal forces. While supermassive black holes might allow crossing the event horizon intact, destruction is inevitable near the singularity. Scientists study this process to test physics boundaries and understand cosmic events, revealing insights into gravity and information paradoxes.

title: 'Doobne ki practice‚Äô: PM Modi's veiled dig at Rahul's fishing bid; takes 'katta' jibe at oppn again
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi mocked Rahul Gandhi's fishing attempt and attacked the RJD's "Jungle Raj" legacy at a Bihar rally. He highlighted the NDA's development agenda, contrasting it with the RJD's alleged promotion of crime and corruption among youth, urging voters to choose progress over the past.

title: Rajinikanth‚Äôs brother suffers heart attack; superstar rushes to Bengaluru
content: Superstar Rajinikanth's elder brother, Sathyanarayana Rao Gaikwad, 84, has been hospitalized in Bengaluru after suffering a heart attack. The actor immediately rushed from Chennai to be by his brother's side, who is currently in the ICU.  Fans are sending prayers for his speedy recovery as he remains under medical observation.

title: Connectivity boost: PM Modi flags off four new Vande Bharat trains; check time-table
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has launched four new Vande Bharat Express trains, enhancing rail travel across key Indian routes. These modern, high-speed trains will connect Bengaluru-Ernakulam, Varanasi-Khajuraho, Lucknow Junction-Saharanpur, and Firozpur Cantt-Delhi.

title: Top rainforests on Earth and why they‚Äôre essential for our planet‚Äôs survival
content: Earth's vital rainforests, crucial for oxygen production and climate regulation, face severe threats from deforestation and human activities.  From the Amazon to the Congo and Southeast Asia, these biodiversity hotspots are home to unique species and indigenous communities.  Urgent conservation is needed to protect these invaluable natural treasures from ongoing destruction.

title: 'Like a table fan': Ex-IND batter's brutal take on Gill; praises 'storm' Abhishek
content: India eyes an overseas T20I series win against Australia, with opener Shubman Gill under scrutiny. While Abhishek provides explosive starts, Gill's inconsistent form is a concern. Former batter Sadagoppan Ramesh likened their dynamic to a "storm and a table fan," emphasizing the crucial role of the opening partnership in setting formidable totals.

title: Rising air pollution: Tharoor takes 'Delhi injurious to health' dig; shares old post
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor has pointed out Delhi-NCR's ongoing air pollution crisis. He shared a six-year-old social media post that remains relevant today. Since Diwali, the national capital's air quality has been poor to severe. The Air Quality Index is high, with many areas reporting very poor conditions. Shallow fog is also expected, reducing visibility.

title: ‚ÄòNo one visited this Diwali‚Äô: Family of Muskan Rastogi puts house on sale; plans to leave Meerut
content: Facing social boycott and painful memories after their daughter's alleged involvement in a sensational murder case, the Rastogi family has put their Meerut residence up for sale. The family's jewellery business has collapsed, and they are ostracized by the community, leading to their decision to leave the city.

title: ‚ÄòImmigrant could become public charge‚Äô: Getting a US visa may get harder for many ‚Äì who's affected?
content: A new Trump administration directive instructs consular officers to consider applicants' health conditions and ability to afford treatment when determining visa eligibility. This move expands the 'public charge' rule, potentially impacting individuals with chronic illnesses and raising concerns about discrimination and arbitrary decisions.

title: Body language expert decodes Shah Rukh Khan‚Äôs ‚Äòalpha gesture‚Äô
content: Body language expert Kaanan Tandi analyzed Shah Rukh Khan's 'alpha gesture,' noting his confident 'cowboy cross' posture. However, Tandi highlighted Khan's awareness in adjusting his body language, particularly by avoiding this pose when in the presence of women or respected seniors, demonstrating consideration and respect.

title: Jasprit Bumrah set to create history no Indian has achieved before - big record on the line
content: Overall, in 79 T20Is,  Jasprit Bumrah has picked up 99 wickets in 77 innings at an average of 18.11, with best figures of 3/7 and an economy rate of 6.36. He is currently India‚Äôs second-highest wicket-taker in the format, behind Arshdeep Singh, who has 105 wickets in 67 matches.

title: Lauren Kyle launches Oilers Collection 03, a racing-inspired Sports Club Atelier line
content: Lauren Kyle, founder of Sports Club Atelier and wife of Connor McDavid, has unveiled "Oilers Collection 03," a new capsule inspired by classic motorsport style. The collection blends the Oilers' iconic colors with high-end streetwear and automotive aesthetics, drawing from vintage racing suits and team heritage. Kyle shared a preview on Instagram, highlighting the performance-driven fashion.

title: Alex Vesia‚Äôs baby‚Äôs tragic death: Fans speculate cause after his announcement
content: Los Angeles Dodgers pitcher Alex Vesia and his wife Kayla announced the heartbreaking loss of their newborn daughter, Sterling Sol Vesia, who passed away on October 26, 2025. The couple had shared their pregnancy news in April 2025. While the cause remains unconfirmed, online speculation points to stillbirth. This tragedy explains Alex's absence from the World Series and subsequent parade.

title: Spot on! Ex-IND coach turns astrologer; wild World Cup prediction comes true
content: Former India fielding coach Biju George boldly predicted India's Women's World Cup victory, a prophecy that came true as they defeated Australia in the semis and South Africa in the final. He attributed the win to the team's evolving dynamics, improved finishing, and exceptional fielding, highlighting Harmanpreet Kaur's growth and the impact of players like Jemimah Rodrigues.

title: US grants Hungary one-year exemption from Russian oil sanctions; here's why
content: The United States has granted Hungary a one-year exemption from its sanctions on Russian oil and gas following a personal appeal from Prime Minister Viktor Orb√°n to President Donald Trump. Trump cited Hungary's landlocked status and lack of ports as reasons for the exemption, while Orb√°n warned of severe economic consequences.

title: Cash prizes, govt jobs: India's World Cup heroines showered with rewards
content: India's ICC Women's World Cup 2025 victory has ignited nationwide celebrations.  Players are receiving grand welcomes and substantial rewards from their home states.  From Maharashtra's Rs 2.25 crore for Mandhana and Rodrigues to Andhra Pradesh's Rs 2.5 crore for Shree Charani, these honours highlight the immense pride and inspiration the team has brought to every corner of the nation.

title: Al-Qaeda, ISIS-linked unrest in Mali: Five Indian workers kidnapped near Kobri
content: Five Indian nationals working on electrification projects in Mali have been kidnapped near Kobri by gunmen. The company has evacuated remaining Indian employees to Bamako as a precaution. This incident highlights Mali's ongoing struggle with rising insecurity and violence from jihadist groups, with no group yet claiming responsibility for the abduction.

title: This 15-minute Japanese ritual can reduce the risk of stroke and boost heart health
content: Discover a simple Japanese habit that relaxes your mind and boosts circulation. Soaking feet in warm water for 15-20 minutes improves blood flow and reduces stress. This practice also aids sleep and eases muscle tension. It is especially beneficial for older adults, those with anxiety, and individuals facing sleep issues.

title: ‚ÄòSomething special‚Äô: Trump endorses Vivek in Ohio governor race; calls him ‚Äòyoung, strong, smart‚Äô
content: Donald Trump has thrown his significant weight behind Indian-origin entrepreneur Vivek Ramaswamy for the 2026 Ohio governor race, issuing a strong endorsement. Trump lauded Ramaswamy as a "SPECIAL" candidate, highlighting his youth, strength, and love for the country. This backing comes as Republicans aim to unite behind Ramaswamy, a conservative outsider, in a state Trump has won decisively.

title: 'Aaj sher ghaas khaa raha tha': Suryakumar Yadav takes a dig at Abhishek Sharma - Watch
content: India secured victory in the 4th T20I against Australia in a low-scoring match in Queensland, where several players, including Abhishek Sharma and captain Suryakumar Yadav, faced batting challenges on a difficult pitch. India posted 167/8, which proved sufficient as Australia was bowled out for 119 in 18.2 overs. Abhishek, who had been dominant against the Australian bowlers throughout the series, managed only 28 runs from 21 balls, batting well below his usual strike rate of over 200.

title: 116-year-old world‚Äôs oldest living woman's secret to long life is not exercise but...
content: At 116 years old, Ethel Caterham is officially the oldest person alive.  She credits her incredible lifespan not to strict diets or intense workouts, but to a calm mind.  Her key to living so long?  She avoids arguments and always sticks to her own decisions, living life on her own terms.

title: Former Magic coach and analyst Richie Adubato dies at 87 after illness
content: Basketball mourns the loss of Richie Adubato, 87, a beloved coach and broadcaster whose six-decade career touched the NBA, WNBA, and radio waves. Known for his wit and passion, Adubato left an indelible mark on the sport, from coaching the Orlando Magic to mentoring players and entertaining fans. His genuine spirit and humor will be deeply missed.

title: "Bhaiya Mat Karo": Woman In Bengaluru Says Rapido Rider Tried To Grab Her Legs
content: A Rapido bike taxi rider in Bengaluru has been charged for allegedly misbehaving with a woman passenger during a ride in the city.

title: If I Can Be Duped, What About Common People? Trinamool MP After Cyber Fraud
content: Trinamool Congress (TMC) MP Kalyan Banerjee on Saturday expressed concern over the rising incidents of cyber fraud, questioning how ordinary citizens could be protected if even public representatives like him could fall prey to such scams.

title: Kerala Woman Forced To Drink Alcohol, Smoke Beedi To "Evict Ghost From Body"
content: A young woman was allegedly forced to smoke beedi and drink alcohol while being subjected to hours-long physical and mental torture in the name of black magic in Kottayam district of Kerala, police said on Saturday.

title: Israeli National Killed In Motorcycle Crash In UP
content: An Israeli tourist en route from Delhi to Agra on a motorcycle as part of his India tour died in a road accident on Friday morning.

title: "A Mistake": Patna Admin On LJP's Shambhavi Chaudhary's Ink Marks On Fingers
content: The Patna District Administration on Saturday clarified on a video circulating on social media regarding ink marks on both fingers of LJP (Ram Vilas) MP Shambhavi Chaudhary after she cast her vote.

title: Parliament Winter Session To Be Held From December 1-19: Kiren Rijiju
content: Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju said he is looking forward to a "constructive and meaningful" winter session of Parliament.

title: Afghanistan-Pak Peace Talks End Without Deal To Tackle Cross-Border Terror
content: Peace talks between Pakistan and Afghan Taliban ended without any agreement to tackle the thorny issues of cross-border terrorism as the deadlock persisted, according to top officials.

title: "Hire Attractive People": Indian-Origin Start-Up Founders Face Racial Trolling
content: Two IIT Kharagpur graduates and Forbes 30 Under 30 alumni were subjected to racist trolling shortly after they revealed that their San Francisco-based startup, Giga, had secured $61 million in funding.

title: Video: Palestinian Boy, "Zohran Mamdani Of Gaza", Celebrates His Mayoral Win
content: The boy, who also has a beard drawn on his face, waves to them, imitating none other than Zohran Mamdani, the new Mayor-elect of New York.

title: "Will See After Results": Asaduddin Owaisi To NDTV On Joining Grand Alliance In Bihar
content: The Opposition alliance includes Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD), Congress, and the Left parties as the main constituents.

title: "Bihar's Children Need To Dream Of Startups, Not 'Hands Up'": PM Modi Rips Into RJD
content: The Rashtriya Janata Dal is poisoning the children's minds, Prime Minister Narendra Modi has said at a rally in Bihar, tearing into the Tejashwi Yadav-led party with 'jungle raj' jibes.

title: Air India Mumbai-London Flight Delayed By Over 6 Hours Due To Tech Glitch
content: Air India flight AI129, which was scheduled to depart from Mumbai for London at 6:30 AM, has been delayed on Saturday.

title: Trump Backs "Young, Strong, Smart" Vivek Ramaswamy For Ohio Governor Race
content: Vivek Ramaswamy is "something special", US President Donald Trump has said in a social media post, throwing his weight behind the Indian-origin billionaire Republican for the 2026 Ohio Governor race.

title: Can You Really Talk To The Dead Using AI: Comfort Or Illusion?
content: Artificial intelligence (AI) is increasingly being used to preserve the voices and stories of the dead. From text-based chatbots that mimic loved ones to voice avatars that let you "speak" with the deceased

title: 2 Jails Raided In Jammu And Kashmir Amid Crackdown On Terror Activities
content: The simultaneous searches were conducted at the Central Jail, Srinagar, and District Jail, Kupwara, sources said.

title: "Opposition Needs Self-Introspection": Asaduddin Owaisi To NDTV On Bihar Polls
content: Speaking to NDTV two days after Bihar went to polls in the first phase of assembly elections, Asaduddin Owaisi rejected the Opposition's claim that the AIMIM is a "vote cutter" party.

title: "PM Modi Instilling Fear Of RJD To Get Votes": Prashant Kishor
content: "Jungle raj" is an apparent reference to the time when Bihar was under the rule of RJD chief Lalu Yadav.

title: "Is There A Gold Rush In Bihar?" A Owaisi To NDTV On Infiltration Charge
content: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi has snubbed the BJP's charge that the Opposition uses infiltrators as a vote bank,accusing the NDA combine in Bihar of defaming the Muslims after ignoring their progress.

title: Woman Throws Chilli Powder At Jeweller In Robbery Bid, Gets Slapped 20 Times
content: A woman who entered a jewellery shop in Gujarat's Ahmedabad with the intention of robbing it ended up being slapped nearly 20 times in 25 seconds by the shopkeeper after her plan went awry.

title: Drunk Cop Rams Multiple Motorbikes In Madhya Pradesh, Kills Teacher
content: A peaceful Friday evening turned into a scene of tragedy and carnage on the Neemuch-Jawad Road in Madhya Pradesh after an Assistant Sub-Inspector (ASI) allegedly drove drunk and rammed his vehicle into multiple motorcycles.

title: Thiruvananthapuram Metro Phase I to boost urban mobility; connect airport, technopark, key city hubs
content: A statement from the Chief Minister‚Äôs Office said the project will accelerate the future development of the rapidly growing city of Thiruvananthapuram

title: Maharashtra Minister bought ‚Çπ200-crore land for ‚Çπ3 crore, claims Wadettiwar
content: State Transport Minister Pratap Sarnaik had acquired four acres of land worth around ‚Çπ200 crore at Mira Bhayandar near Mumbai for just ‚Çπ53 crore to set up an educational institute, says Vijay Wadettiwar

title: Train pilot injured as eagle shatters windscreen; lands inside cabin
content: ‚ÄúThe incident occurred in the Baramulla-Banihal train between Bijbehara and Anantnag railway stations,‚Äù officials said

title: Telangana sanctions record ‚Çπ60,799 crore for road development: Minister
content: Among key projects is the ‚Çπ10,400-crore expansion of Hyderabad-Vijayawada highway into high lanes, aimed at improving connectivity between the Capital and the coastal region

title: VACB uncovers official-agent nexus facilitating illegal conversion of wetlands, paddy fields for real estate development
content: The VACB conducted surprise inspections at 27 RDOs and also at the offices of 32 Deputy Collectors tasked with enforcing the Kerala Conservation of Paddy Land and Wetland Act, 2008

title: ‚ÄòKaantha‚Äô trailer: Dulquer Salmaan‚Äôs period drama promises a gripping tale
content: Directed by Selvamani Selvaraj and starring Dulquer Salmaan, Samuthirakani, Rana Daggubati and Bhagyashri Borse, ‚ÄòKaantha‚Äô releases on November 14

title: With Trump skipping G20, 'Vishwaguru' to certainly attend in person: Congress
content: Congress earlier claimed that PM Modi did not attend the ASEAN Summit in Kuala Lumpur last month as he was "avoiding" meeting Donald Trump there

title: Flight operations at Delhi airport returning to normal, says DIAL
content: The situation is expected to be normalised over the next few hours.  During this period, some departure and arrival timings may continue to be adjusted

title: First Vande Bharat sleeper coach maintenance facility to be ready by June
content: The first phase of the maintenance and workshop depot, which includes a 600-metre track facility to maintain 24 sleeper coaches of Vande Bharat trains, will be ready by June, 2026

title: Criticism mounts over move to redeploy 400-odd Junior Resident posts in T.N. govt. medical colleges
content: TNMOA‚Äôs secretary M. Akilan, in a statement, said this move, under the pretext of creating new postgraduate seats, poses a serious threat to healthcare delivery in government medical institutions

title: Premier Energies to invest ‚Çπ5,942 crore in Andhra Pradesh on solar manufacturing hub
content: The upcoming facility will be established at Naidupeta Industrial Park in Nellore district and will feature a 4 GW TOPCon solar cell unit along with a 5 GW silicon ingot and wafer plant

title: India AI summit curtain-raiser organised in Seattle with focus on 'People, Planet, Progress'
content: The briefing on the new Chancery premises of the Indian Consulate in Seattle was the first such curtain raiser in a series of sessions being planned in the run-up to the AI India Impact Summit

title: Vande Mataram remains as moral compass for Indian democracy: Haryana CM
content: On the national song‚Äôs 150th anniversary, Nayab Singh Saini recalls the song‚Äôs history and how it inspired the freedom fighters

title: Antimicrobial resistance is an escalating threat to global health, says expert in Nitte convocation address
content: Dr. K. Srinath Reddy was delivering an address at the 15th convocation of Nitte (Deemed-to-be-University) in Mangaluru

title: Integrity, public service still core to medicine: speaker at Gajaraj Memorial Oration
content: The Prof. Arcot Gajaraj Memorial Oration has been conducted annually since 2005; this year marks the 100th birth anniversary of Dr. Gajaraj

title: NOTTO directs training of first responders in road accident emergencies to ensure harvesting of organs from organ donors
content: NOTTO said that large number of deaths occur due to road traffic accidents (RTAs), especially involving young and otherwise healthy individuals

title: Three dead in two road accidents in Visakhapatnam, Anakapalli
content: In the first incident, a man died on the spot while pillion rider, a woman, escaped with minor injuries after their electrical scooter hit by a lorry on the main road near Maddilapalem

title: Two terrorists killed in failed infiltration bid in J&K's Kupwara
content: The Army's Srinagar-based Chinar Corps said an operation was launched on Friday (November 7) based on specific intelligence inputs from agencies about an infiltration attempt in Keran sector of Kupwara

title: Indian student's body recovered from river in Russia, family urges Govt. for urgent repatriation
content: The local authorities have sent the body for post-mortem before initiating its repatriation to India, which could take up to two days, the 22-year-old‚Äôs uncle said

title: PM Modi flags off four new Vande Bharat Express trains from Varanasi
content: The four new Vande Bharat Express train routes are ‚Äì Banaras-Khajuraho, Lucknow-Saharanpur, Firozpur-Delhi, and Ernakulam-Bengaluru

title: Ahead of COP30, India to join new global tropical forest fund as ‚ÄòObserver‚Äô

title: Mumbai-led team helps reveal mysterious twin rings around galaxy
content: Most members of the RAD@home initiative, launched in 2013 by Ananda Hota, are not professional astronomers, yet after a little training, they help spot unusual astronomical phenomena

title: BJP cites insult to Bankim Chandra, Trinamool highlights snub to Tagore

content: "Half of the State has already shown the door to the Congress-RJD combine," claims Union Home Minister Amit Shah, referring to the first phase of the polls.

title: Video showing children being served mid-day meal on scrap paper in Madhya Pradesh school sparks outrage

content: Trinamool Congress leadership said that out of 12 states where the SIR is being held the¬†Banglar Vote Raksha is ‚Äúone and only initiative‚Äô by a political party to assist the electorate on such a large scale.

title: Breaking boundaries: The changing reality of Indian women‚Äôs cricket
content: Over the last few years, more girls and women across India are playing cricket professionally, inspired by the tremendous growth of the game. India‚Äôs victory in the ICC Women‚Äôs World Cup in early November has inspired many more budding players. Mehul Malpani, Amol Yashwant Karhadkar, Y.B. Sarangi, and Suruchi Kumari report on the changing reality of Indian women‚Äôs cricket

content: The delivery of engines will begin from 2027, and the supplies will have to be completed by 2032, officials said; the deal comes despite the downturn in the India-U.S. ties over tariffs

title: BJP trying to weaken legacy of independence movement, says Ashok Gehlot

title: Places of prayer turn perilous
content: The stampede at Sri Venkateswara Swamy temple in Kasibugga on November 1, is the deadliest of its kind this year, claiming nine lives. Brought about by a combination of poor judgement, social media hype and hollow safeguards, the tragedy lays bare glaring holes in crowd management at temples in Andhra Pradesh, writes Hareesh P.¬†
